about_tagline: Named after the legendary sword from Lord of the Rings that glows blue when danger is near, Sting9 illuminates the threats hiding in your inbox.
about_mission_text: The Sting9 Research Initiative is building the world's most comprehensive open-source dataset of phishing, smishing, and scam messages to train AI models capable of detecting malicious communications with 99.9% accuracy. By combining community contributions with existing datasets, we're creating a powerful resource to protect billions of users from digital deception.
about_problem_text: Every day, millions of people receive fraudulent messages designed to steal their personal information, money, and digital identities. Current detection systems struggle to keep pace with evolving threats:
about_approach1_description: Building a global network of contributors who submit suspected phishing and smishing messages. Every contribution helps our AI learn new attack patterns.
about_approach2_description: Aggregating and standardizing data from user submissions, partner organizations, academic research, threat intelligence feeds, and honeypot networks.
about_approach3_description: Machine learning models analyze message content, sender patterns, URLs, social engineering tactics, and cross-language threat patterns.
about_approach4_description: All datasets and trained models freely available to researchers, security companies, developers, and anyone combating digital fraud.
about_privacy1: All personal information is automatically redacted
about_cta_text: Join the fight against digital deception. Every contribution matters.
about_closing: Together, we can make digital deception obsolete.
stats_description: Explore comprehensive statistics about our growing dataset of phishing, smishing, and scam messages.
stats_cta_text: Every submission makes our detection models more accurate. Submit suspicious messages you've received to contribute to the fight against digital deception.
research_subtitle: Access the Sting9 dataset, API documentation, and research resources
research_api_docs_description: Interactive API reference with endpoints, authentication, and code examples
research_dataset_description: Download the Sting9 dataset for training your own models (authentication required)
research_auth_description: Learn how to register as a researcher and authenticate API requests with JWT tokens
research_examples_description: Sample code in Python, JavaScript, Go, and more to integrate with the Sting9 API
research_quickstart_intro: Get started with the Sting9 API in minutes:
research_support_text: Contact our research team for support, partnerships, or questions
api_docs_subtitle: REST API for submitting and analyzing phishing, smishing, and scam messages
contact_subtitle: Have questions, feedback, or want to learn more about Sting9? We'd love to hear from you.
contact_submit_text: To contribute to the dataset, use our submission portal:
contact_response_text: We typically respond to inquiries within 24-48 hours during business days. For urgent matters, please indicate this in your message.
contact_form_priority_low: Low - Can wait a few days
contact_form_message_placeholder: Please provide as much detail as possible...
contact_form_message_hint: Minimum 10 characters. Be as specific as possible.
contact_form_newsletter: Subscribe to Sting9 newsletter for updates on dataset milestones, new research findings, and AI model releases
contact_success_message: Thank you for reaching out to Sting9. We've received your message and will respond within 24-48 hours.
partners_subtitle: Join the fight against digital deception by partnering with the Sting9 Research Initiative.
partners_intro: We're looking for organizations committed to protecting users from phishing, smishing, and scam attacks. Together, we can build the world's most comprehensive anti-fraud dataset.
partners_benefit1_text: Get priority access to new datasets, models, and API features before public release.
partners_benefit2_text: Work with our team to integrate Sting9 detection into your products and services.
partners_benefit3_text: Access real-time threat feeds and emerging attack patterns affecting your industry.
partners_benefit4_text: Collaborate on research papers, studies, and publications with our security experts.
partners_benefit5_text: Be recognized as a Sting9 partner committed to protecting users from digital fraud.
partners_benefit6_text: Get priority support and a dedicated account manager for your integration needs.
partners_form_industry_placeholder: e.g., Cybersecurity, Email Provider, Financial Services
partners_form_contact_title_placeholder: e.g., CTO, Security Director, Research Lead
partners_form_contribution: How would you like to contribute?
partners_form_contribution_placeholder: Describe how your organization can contribute to the Sting9 initiative...
partners_form_goals_placeholder: What do you hope to achieve through this partnership?
partners_form_integration_placeholder: Describe your current email/messaging security solutions...
partners_form_api_usage_placeholder: How do you plan to use the Sting9 API or dataset?
partners_form_additional_placeholder: Any other information you'd like to share...
partners_success_text: Thank you for your interest in partnering with Sting9. Our team will review your application and contact you within 5 business days.
license_intro: The Sting9 dataset is released under a modified Open Data Commons Attribution-NonCommercial (ODC-BY-NC) license to ensure it remains freely available for non-commercial research and education while preventing misuse.
license_definitions_dataset: "Dataset" refers to the Sting9 collection of anonymized phishing, smishing, and scam messages, including all metadata, labels, and associated files.
license_definitions_use: "Use" includes accessing, downloading, copying, modifying, analyzing, training machine learning models with, and creating derivative works from the Dataset.
license_definitions_commercial: "Commercial Use" means any use primarily intended for or directed toward commercial advantage or monetary compensation.
license_definitions_noncommercial: "Non-Commercial Use" means use that is not primarily intended for or directed toward commercial advantage or monetary compensation, including academic research, education, and personal projects.
license_grant_text: Subject to the terms of this license, Sting9 Research Initiative (operated by nlsio LLC) grants you a worldwide, royalty-free, non-exclusive license to:
license_grant2: Use the Dataset for Non-Commercial purposes
license_grant3: Create derivative works for Non-Commercial purposes
license_grant4: Share the Dataset and derivatives under this same license
license_conditions_attribution_text: You must give appropriate credit by:
license_conditions_attribution1: Citing "Sting9 Research Initiative (sting9.org)" in any publications, papers, or documentation
license_conditions_attribution2: Including a link to sting9.org when using the dataset publicly
license_conditions_attribution3: Preserving all copyright and license notices in the dataset files
license_conditions_sharealike_text: If you distribute derivative works, you must:
license_conditions_sharealike1: Use this same license (ODC-BY-NC) or a compatible license
license_conditions_sharealike2: Clearly indicate any changes made to the original dataset
license_conditions_sharealike3: Not impose additional restrictions that conflict with this license
license_restrictions1: Use the Dataset for Commercial purposes without obtaining a separate commercial license
license_restrictions2: Sell, rent, or lease access to the Dataset or derivatives
license_restrictions3: Use the Dataset to create commercial products that compete with Sting9
license_restrictions4: Remove, alter, or obscure any copyright or license notices
license_restrictions5: Use the Dataset in any way that violates applicable laws or regulations
license_restrictions6: Use the Dataset for malicious purposes (creating phishing campaigns, training systems to evade detection, etc.)
license_commercial_text: Organizations wishing to use the Dataset for commercial purposes may apply for a commercial license. Commercial licenses include:
license_commercial1: Extended usage rights for commercial products
license_commercial2: Priority access to new dataset releases
license_commercial4: Custom data feeds and API access
license_commercial_contact: Contact licensing@sting9.org for commercial licensing inquiries.
license_disclaimer_text: THE DATASET IS PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED. Sting9 Research Initiative and nlsio LLC disclaim all warranties, including but not limited to accuracy, completeness, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement. Users assume all risk associated with use of the Dataset.
license_questions_text: If you're unsure whether your use case qualifies as non-commercial, or if you need a commercial license, please contact us:
dataset_subtitle: Access the Sting9 phishing, smishing, and scam message dataset for research, education, and security applications.
dataset_intro: Our open dataset is available through multiple access methods to suit your research needs. All data is anonymized and released under the ODC-BY-NC license.
dataset_github_description: Download the full dataset from our GitHub repository. Updated weekly with new submissions.
dataset_github_best: Best for: Offline analysis, batch processing, academic research
dataset_api_description: Query the dataset programmatically with our RESTful API. Real-time access to the latest submissions.
dataset_api_best: Best for: Integration, live feeds, application development
dataset_partner_description: Enhanced access with priority support, custom exports, and dedicated API endpoints.
dataset_partner_best: Best for: Enterprise, commercial research, high-volume needs
dataset_schema_description: Each record in the dataset contains the following fields:
dataset_license_text: The Sting9 dataset is released under the ODC-BY-NC (Open Data Commons Attribution-NonCommercial) license. You are free to use, share, and adapt the data for non-commercial purposes with appropriate attribution.
dataset_commercial_text: For commercial applications, enterprise access, or custom licensing arrangements, please contact our licensing team.
submit_email_description: Help us build the world's most comprehensive phishing detection dataset. Submit suspicious emails you've received to contribute to AI training.
submit_email_privacy_text: All personal information (emails, names, phone numbers, addresses) is automatically anonymized before being added to the dataset.
submit_email_guideline3: Note any suspicious links or attachments
submit_email_alternative_text: You can also forward suspicious emails directly to:
submit_email_content_placeholder: Paste the full email content here, including headers if possible...
submit_email_content_help: Required - Minimum 10 characters - Include full message body
submit_email_your_email_help: Optional - We may contact you if we have questions about this submission
submit_email_display_name_help: Optional - For recognition on our contributor leaderboard
submit_email_urls_placeholder: Enter suspicious URLs, one per line or comma-separated
submit_email_urls_help: Comma-separated list of URLs found in the email
submit_email_attachments_placeholder: invoice.pdf, document.zip (do not upload actual files)
submit_email_attachments_help: Comma-separated list of attachment filenames (do not upload the actual files)
submit_email_license_notice: By submitting this email, you confirm that you are contributing to an open-source research dataset and understand that the anonymized data will be released under the ODC-BY-NC license. All personal information will be automatically redacted before publication.
submit_email_success_text: Thank you for contributing to the Sting9 dataset. Your submission will be anonymized and processed to help train AI models that detect phishing emails.
submit_email_next_step1: Your email is automatically scanned and all personal information is redacted
submit_email_next_step2: AI models analyze the content to categorize the threat type
submit_email_next_step3: The anonymized email is added to the public dataset for AI training
submit_email_next_step4: Researchers worldwide use this data to build better phishing detection systems
submit_sms_description: Report smishing (SMS phishing) attempts to help us build better detection systems. Your contribution helps protect millions from text message scams.
submit_sms_type5: Fake job offers or payment requests
submit_sms_type6: Account verification or password reset scams
submit_sms_privacy_text: All phone numbers, names, addresses, and personal information are automatically anonymized before being added to the dataset.
submit_sms_stats_text: Text message scams increased by 174% in 2024, with average losses of $2,100 per victim.
submit_sms_stats_contribution: Your submission helps combat this growing threat.
submit_sms_example1: "USPS: Your package is awaiting delivery. Update your address: [link]"
submit_sms_example2: "Bank Alert: Suspicious activity on your account. Verify immediately: [link]"
submit_sms_content_placeholder: Paste the suspicious text message here...
submit_sms_content_help: Required - Minimum 10 characters - Copy and paste the full message
submit_sms_your_email_help: Optional - We may contact you if we have questions about this submission
submit_sms_display_name_help: Optional - For recognition on our contributor leaderboard
submit_sms_phone_help: Include country code if known. This will be anonymized.
submit_sms_date_help: When did you receive this message?
submit_sms_urls_placeholder: Enter any suspicious URLs from the message, one per line or comma-separated
submit_sms_urls_help: Comma-separated list of URLs. Do not click on suspicious links!
submit_sms_safety_text: Do not click on any links in suspicious messages. Do not reply to the sender. Do not provide personal information. Just copy the text and submit it here.
submit_sms_license_notice: By submitting this message, you confirm that you are contributing to an open-source research dataset and understand that the anonymized data will be released under the ODC-BY-NC license. All personal information will be automatically redacted before publication.
submit_sms_success_text: Thank you for contributing to the Sting9 dataset. Your submission will be anonymized and processed to help train AI models that detect smishing attacks.
submit_sms_next_step1: Your message is automatically scanned and all phone numbers and personal info are redacted
submit_sms_next_step2: AI models analyze the content, URLs, and patterns to categorize the threat type
submit_sms_next_step3: The anonymized SMS is added to the public dataset for AI training
submit_sms_next_step4: Mobile carriers and security companies use this data to block similar smishing attempts
submit_sms_carrier_text: In addition to submitting here, forward spam texts to 7726 (SPAM). This helps carriers block the sender.
home_hero_subtitle: An open-source research initiative collecting phishing, smishing, and scam messages to train AI models capable of detecting malicious communications with
home_hero_privacy_notice: All submissions are automatically anonymized. No tracking. GDPR compliant.
home_stats_subtitle: Real-time progress toward our goal of 1 million messages
home_stats_progress_text: of 1,000,000 messages • Every submission brings us closer to 99.9% detection accuracy
home_leaderboard_subtitle: Recognizing the heroes who help build the world's largest phishing detection dataset
home_leaderboard_be_first: Be the first to contribute and claim the top spot!
home_leaderboard_cta_text: Want to see your nickname here?
home_leaderboard_cta_description: Submit suspicious messages and include your nickname to join the leaderboard!
home_how_it_works_subtitle: From submission to protection in four transparent steps
home_how_it_works_step1_description: Forward phishing emails or paste smishing texts. Upload screenshots or message files. Anonymous submissions welcome.
home_how_it_works_step2_description: Our system immediately redacts all personal information—emails, phone numbers, names, addresses, and identifiers—to protect your privacy.
home_how_it_works_step3_description: The anonymized message joins our CC0 public dataset, categorized by type, language, and threat characteristics for research access.
home_how_it_works_step4_description: Your contribution trains machine learning models used by individuals, organizations, and researchers to detect and prevent future attacks.
home_how_it_works_cta_text: Every message you submit helps protect millions of people from digital deception. Together, we're building the most comprehensive anti-phishing defense system ever created.
home_impact_subtitle: From open data to global protection, our mission reaches millions
home_impact_enable1_description: State-of-the-art machine learning trained on the largest, most diverse phishing dataset ever created.
home_impact_enable2_description: Live feeds of emerging attack patterns, malicious URLs, and new scam techniques as they appear.
home_impact_enable3_description: Free API and dataset downloads for academic researchers, developers, and security professionals worldwide.
home_impact_benefit1_description: Everyday users gain protection through email clients, messaging apps, and browsers powered by our detection models.
home_impact_benefit2_description: Businesses integrate our API to protect employees from BEC, credential harvesting, and targeted phishing campaigns.
home_impact_benefit3_description: Academic institutions and security labs use our dataset to advance cybersecurity science and develop new defenses.
home_impact_opensource_item1_text: Open Data Commons Attribution-NonCommercial—free for research and non-commercial use
home_impact_opensource_item2_text: RESTful API for researchers and developers—no paywalls
home_impact_opensource_item3_text: Open documentation of collection, anonymization, and classification processes
home_impact_opensource_item4_text: Detection models freely available for personal and research use
home_impact_opensource_quote: Making digital deception obsolete through radical transparency and collaboration
home_threats_title: Learn to Spot the Red Flags
home_threats_subtitle: Real examples from our dataset (anonymized and redacted) showing common phishing and smishing techniques
home_threats_example1_preview:
From: delivery@amaz0n-support.com
Subject: Your package is waiting - Action Required!

Dear Customer,

Your package has been held due to incomplete address information. Click here to update your delivery details within 24 hours or your package will be returned...
home_threats_example2_preview:
ALERT: Unusual activity detected on your account ending in 3847. Verify your identity immediately: http://bit.ly/2xK9pL

If you did not authorize this transaction, click the link now to prevent further charges.

-Your Bank Security Team
home_threats_example3_preview:
From: winners@international-lottery-commission.biz
Subject: CONGRATULATIONS! You've Won $2,500,000 USD

Dear Lucky Winner,

You have been selected as the winner of our international sweepstakes. To claim your prize, please provide your bank details and pay a processing fee of $450...
home_threats_example3_flag2: Request for payment to receive winnings
home_threats_example3_flag4: Too good to be true offer
home_threats_cta_text: When you submit a suspicious message, you're not just protecting yourself—you're helping us identify new attack patterns and educate millions of people worldwide about emerging threats.
footer_tagline: Building the world's most comprehensive open-source dataset of phishing and smishing messages to make digital deception obsolete.
footer_copyright: Sting9 Research Initiative. Dataset released under
